result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony P Panella was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Anthony P Panella in court, in custody by video.   Mary Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    The court calls the case to address the defendant's request to amend the sentence credit.  The defendant present an argument to the court requesting additional 203 days sentence credit on 14CF825.    The state stipulates.  The court grants the defendant's request and will amend the judgment of conviction to 203 days credit in 14CF752.
4/18/19 minutes corrected should be 203 days credit to 14CF825.
Review hearing on April 18, 2018 at 10:00 am.
From defendant dated 3/22/18 re sentence credit.
From defendant dated 2/9/18 re sentence credit. (2 letters with same information)
To State requesting response by 12/13/17.
Motion for Sentence Credit filed by defendant, pro se.

From defendant dated 11/18/17 requesting additional sentence credit.
  **Reviewed by Judge Michael J. Aprahamian on 11/28/17; Ask State for a response.**
Order denying additional sentence credit signed by Judge Aprahamian 11/20/17.

Defendant Anthony P Panella in court, in custody, with attorney Gary R. Schmaus.   Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Amended Information filed - reading waived.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1 and 2.  Court finds defendant guilty. Ct. 3 dismissed and read-in. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- Withheld sentence for 3 years Probation - concurrent to Ct. 2 and 14CF825 - 173 days credit if revoked
- Court Costs of $343.00 (includes DVSurcharge) to be paid as a Condition of Probation 
- DNA Surcharge of $200.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Restitution of $58.00 to be paid to Ashley T. as a Condition of Probation
- Conditions of  Probation: Maintain absolute sobriety.   Submit to an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.  Random drug screens.   Domestic violence counseling to be determined by Agent. No contact with Ashley T.. No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed. No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e. bars, taverns, or liquor stores).  DNA Sample if not yet provided.
- 150 days jail Condition Time (nonworking hours) - 1st 90 days Condition Time with Huber commencing forthwith. Last 60 days STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion. Agent has the discretion to impose huber or straight time. Nonworking hours with standard release conditions.

Ct. 2:
- Withheld sentence for 3 years Probation - concurrent to Ct. 1 and 14CF825
- Court Costs of $343.00 (includes DVSurcharge) to be paid as a Condition of Probation 
- DNA Surcharge of $200.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Conditions of  Probation: Maintain absolute sobriety.   Submit to an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.  Random drug screens.   Domestic violence counseling to be determined by Agent. No contact with Ashley T.. No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed. No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e. bars, taverns, or liquor stores).  DNA Sample if not yet provided.

Expungement addressed. 
State argues against expungement
Court does not think expungement is appropriate
